intro: Opicrina angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed opicrina, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Opicrina angustifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
